intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. defloccatum, commonly known as the mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in moist, calcareous habitats. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with dense white hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn.
